description: Latin rubricatus, past participle of rubricare (“to colour red”). See rubric.

adjectives.description: rubricate (comparative more rubricate, superlative most rubricate)

verbs.description: rubricate (third-person singular simple present rubricates, present participle rubricating, simple past and past participle rubricated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To write in the form of a rubric.
To create rubrication; to illuminate a manuscript with red letters.
